reporting-org.narrative: UTZ - joined forces with Rainforest Alliance

title.narrative: Building capacities for sector change program

description.narrative: Building capacities for sector change program

In 2020 we will have strengthened the lobby and advocacy capacity of civil society organizations in Indonesia, Central America, Kenya, Uganda, Cote d'Ivoire, Ghana, Malawi. As a result we will see an improvement of policy environment (both government and companies) and support services in these countries related to one or more priority themes. On the global level, we will influence the agenda, discourse and policies of International sector platforms and companies related to these themes. These themes are: 1. Sustainable productivity Raising smallholder productivity in a sustainable way is a key component of sector transformation. It is needed to increase income of the farmer and increase production while lowering the environmental footprint. 2. Smallholder inclusion & farmer group strengthening The aim is to increase the inclusion of smallholders in supply-chain driven sustainability programs. Strengthening farmer organizations is seen as an important way to increase the bargaining power of smallholder farmers in the supply chain. 3. Women’s empowerment and gender The goal is to increase the inclusion of women in certification and access to benefits as well as to reduce discrimination and violence against women. 4. Climate and water The focus is on up scaling of best practices in smallholder adaptation to climate change and sustainable water use. 5. Child labor The focus is on prevention, monitoring and remediation of child labor. 6. Living wage The goal is to improve wages of workers on coffee and tea estates towards a living wage.

title.narrative: Country Scan

description.narrative: During the first part of the inception phase of the program (December 2015-March 2016) UTZ Country Representatives / SP focal points, supported by external consultants and UTZ Amsterdam staff, carried out a deeper analysis of the sector(s) and themes proposed for their countries to develop a more focused approach for the SP program. The objective of the Country Scans was “to provide a situational analysis on each sector and theme per country assessing the current state with regards to the relevant thematic SP objectives, clearly formulating the causes of the problem that need addressing and identify opportunities for interventions and provide recommendations on potential partners for these interventions.” The Country Scan documents are based on our own experience in the countries, but also document review, conversations/interviews with experts, key informants including Dutch embassy staff, national and international organizations, and workshop results with many of these actors.

title.narrative: # of country scans

comment.narrative: 9 country scans are completed (including country scans for India and Ethiopia)

title.narrative: Country Plan

description.narrative: During the second part of the inception phase of the program (April-July 2016) UTZ Country Representatives / SP focal points, supported by external consultants and UTZ Amsterdam staff in drafting the country plans. The purpose of the SP country program plan is to set out a strategic direction for sector change in the country and serves as a framework. This plan clearly states UTZ goals for the country the Theory of Change to guide interventions as well as the budget for said activities. Overall, the SP Country Plan will serve as a guide for the next years, as well as a basis for the year plans that will be formulated for 2017 to 2020.

title.narrative: # of country plans

comment.narrative: 7 country plans are completed

title.narrative: Baseline Report

description.narrative: The baseline provides an elaborate context-analysis per country, containing details about capacity of partners and the current state regarding the thematic goals for L&A. The baseline focuses on three main areas: a. Description of baseline situation of context and stakeholders b. Baseline of outcomes of ToC c. Capacities assessment

title.narrative: # of baseline reports

comment.narrative: 8 baseline reports are completed (7 country/region + 1 global)

title.narrative: Inception Report

description.narrative: The purpose of the inception report is to inform the results of the first phase of the SP program and to set out a strategic direction for sector change through implementation of the UTZ sector partnership program. It serves as a framework for the following year plans (2017-2020).

title.narrative: # of inception reports

description.narrative: The Inception report includes a description of the global strategies (in line with the program ToC), the country plans (incl country specific ToCs), thematic ToCs and baseline reports.

comment.narrative: 1 inception report for the SP program is completed
10-01-2018: 1 inception report for the SP program completed
